summary: This document details a meeting between Assistant State Attorney Lana Belohlavic and law enforcement regarding the arrest warrant request for Jeffrey Epstein. The discussion revolves around the charges against Epstein, the implications of his residency in the Virgin Islands, and the credibility of a victim named SG. The document highlights disagreements over the charges and the process of submitting a new probable cause affidavit.

persons.name: Lana Belohlavic
persons.context: Lana Belohlavic is involved in discussions regarding the charges against Jeffrey Epstein and the implications of those charges.

persons.name: Barry Krisher
persons.context: Barry Krisher is mentioned as having met with Epstein's defense counsel to discuss the charges and the implications of Epstein's residency.

persons.name: Dean
persons.context: Sgt Dean is briefed on the discussions regarding the charges against Epstein.

persons.name: Gudger
persons.context: Capt Gudger is also briefed on the discussions regarding the charges against Epstein.

connections.description: Lana Belohlavic and Barry Krisher work together in the State Attorney's Office, discussing legal strategies regarding Epstein's charges.
Barry Krisher is the State Attorney involved in the prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein.
SG is identified as a victim in the case against Jeffrey Epstein.
Lana Belohlavic, as an Assistant State Attorney, is involved in the legal proceedings concerning SG's allegations against Epstein.

events.title: Meeting Regarding Epstein's Charges
events.description: A meeting took place to discuss the arrest warrant request for Jeffrey Epstein and the implications of the charges.

events.title: Follow-up Contact
events.description: A telephone contact was made to discuss the Florida State Statute for charging Epstein.

keyFacts: The original charges against Epstein would classify him as a sexual offender in the Virgin Islands.
The State Attorney agreed to seek a felony solicitation of prostitution charge instead.
Defense counsel argued that the victim SG was not credible based on her personal profile on a social media site.
There was disagreement over the necessity of submitting a new probable cause affidavit for Epstein.
The statute discussed for solicitation of prostitution was interpreted differently by the involved parties.
